alert.note: Alert for Bristol Bay (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued December 09 at 5:08AM AKST until December 11 at 9:00AM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY MORNING THROUGH MONDAY MORNING FROM DILLINGHAM, NORTHEAST... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions possible. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches possible. Winds could gust as high as 40 mph. Visibility down to a quarter of a mile at times. * WHERE...Bristol Bay from Dillingham, northeast. * WHEN...From Sunday morning through Monday morning. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery conditions. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility and cause drifting snow. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...An upper low will lift into the Greater Bristol Bay area on Sunday bringing with it a combination of snow and gusty winds. Blowing snow will become an increasing concern with periods of reduced visibility down to a quarter of a mile at times. There are still some uncertainties with exact snow amounts, but gusty conditions are likely. Any snow that does fall should easily become transportable.
info.instruction: A Winter Storm Watch for blizzard conditions means there is a potential for falling and/or blowing snow with strong winds and extremely poor visibilities. This can lead to whiteout conditions and make travel very hazardous.
